content.description: Climb smooth face/blunt arete on left side of the cliff. Climb past/over small roof to strenuous slightly overhanging section on side pulls to easier climbing above.
content.location: Left most route on main wall. Below boulder guarding upper canyon.

content.protection: Cams to 4", nuts and or hexes, 1 sling for a horn. You can choose to clip 2 bolts on "Leonardo" at about 2/5-3/5 height. Chain anchors with hooks shared with "Krang" and "The Technodrome"
content.location: just left of the "Turtle Face" on the main terrace.

content.description: Climb face using positive crimp edges and small ledges, trend leftward following bolts and crystal filled shallow crack, climb through slight bulge and back rightward and up the final vertical section to chains shared with "Bebop".
content.protection: 5 bolts and chains anchors with hooks. The 1st and 5th bolts and chains are shared with "Bebop".
content.location: Left route of the two on the highest terrace.

climbs.name: Raphael
climbs.fa: Jackson Bain, Nick Martel, Kristina Bergdahl. January 2012

content.description: Climb left side of the "Turtle Shell" face under the left arching crack using good but far apart edges and barely there crimps. A funky move gains you the crack then turn the left side of the roof. Thin climbing on tiny crimps get you to the final jugs and the chains.
content.protection: 7 Bolts and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: Left route starting under the arching crack.

content.description: Down canyon from the main wall is a semi-independent tower called the "Chanel 6 News Tower" Mr Thompson ascends the right side of the tower starting between the tower and the main wall. It is mostly 5.4-5.5 less than vertical climbing with a single 5.6 crux move over a vertical/slightly overhanging bulge using a crimp and a waist-high high-step. this would be a good 1st lead for someone. It also provides access to the other 2 sets of anchors on the tower if you want to work those on top rope.
content.protection: 4 camouflaged bolts and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: The up-hill (right) side of the semi-independent "Chanel 6 News Tower) immediately down-canyon of the main wall.

climbs.name: Michelangelo
climbs.fa: Jackson Bain, Nick Martel, Kristina Bergdahl. January 2012

content.description: Climb the "Turtle Shell" face under the left arching crack. Traverse right a few feet to gain the crack as it starts to arch to the left. Climb crack until it becomes horizontal then turn small roof. Continue climbing up thin face above to chains.
content.protection: 8 bolts and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: Rightmost route on the main terrace. Starts on the "Turtle Shell" face under the arching crack/roof.

climbs.name: Master Splinter
climbs.fa: Kristina Bergdahl-Martel, Nick Martel, Mel Martel

content.description: Climb the obvious left arching crack all the way across until it ends, then turn the roof and follow the left angling seam/crack to the anchors of "Leonardo"
content.location: Starts in the same place as "Donatello" at the base of the big arching crack, climb the full length of the crack, then follow seam/crack up and left to finish on the anchors of "Leonardo".

content.description: Climb blocky face to the left of "Shredder" crack trending rightward. Cross "Shredder" crack and traverse a few feet right to a smaller crack then over final bulge to chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: Start from top of boulder guarding upper canyon a few feet left of the "Shredder" crack.

content.description: Start on smooth face below small roof. Turn roof and then traverse slightly left on small edges. Climb up on edges to blocky angular features and a big quartz crystal then up on big juggy edges and slopers to the chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: Just left of (below) big boulder guarding upper canyon.

content.description: The left of the 3 routes on the "Chanel 6 News Tower" the semi-independent tower immediately down-canyon from the main wall. Start all the way around the left corner, traverse rightward and up on a hand rail, grovel past the 2ed bolt, then weave back and forth as you make your way up. Finishing using the right side of the final headwall is easier than the left.
content.protection: 6 bolts and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: The leftmost of the 3 routes on the "Chanel 6 News Tower" the semi-independent tower immediately down-canyon from the main wall. Access the base by heading back down the "rock stairs" part of the approach to the cave-like area at the base of the route. Also a good place to wait out a storm, so long as too much water is not coming down the canyon.

content.description: Climb the obvious left arching crack until it becomes horizontal, then turn the roof in the same place that "Michelangelo" turns it. Continue up and left following the diagonal crack to the anchors of "Raphael".
content.protection: Mid sized nuts and cams. Chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: Starts in the same place as "Donatello" at the base of the big arching crack, climbs up and left to finish on the anchors of "Raphael".

content.description: Climb the flaring crack system to the right of Bebop's bolts. Requires about 5-6 cam placements. Near the top, traverse left to reach anchor. Shares chain anchor with Bebop. A decent warm up for the other trad climbs at this crag.
content.location: Crack to the right of Bepop - furthest climb to the right (uphill) at the crag

content.description: Clip first bolt by stemming canyon. Step back down to small ledge between the top terrace with "Bebop" and "Rocksteady" and the main terrace. Lieback up crack until the crack starts arching left. Clip 2ed bolt and trend right through crux following bolts via positive crimper rails. Climb up to and follow shallow left leaning crystal filled crack. Then climb up and right on jug and big slopers to a final small roof protecting the chains.
content.protection: 6 bolts and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: Starts from small ledge/terrace halfway between the main terrace and the upper terrace. Starts up big left arching crack to face above.

content.description: Climb face then trend right into groove before trending left to the chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts, the first and last shared with "Rocksteady", and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: Rightmost route on the highest terrace. Shares 1st and last bolts and chains with "Rocksteady".

content.description: The middle of the 3 routes on the "Chanel 6 News Tower" the semi-independent tower immediately down-canyon from the main wall. Starts with 2 bolts worth of 5.7/8 climbing on edges to a huge rest jug. Then it climbs 3 bolts worth of overhanging rock on crimps, edges, pockets, sloping ledges, sidepulls and jugs. Fun and entertaining climbing. Short but physical. Still somewhat sharp too so bring your skin.
content.protection: 5 camouflaged bolts and chain anchors with hooks.
content.location: The middle of the 3 routes on the "Chanel 6 News Tower" the semi-independent tower immediately down-canyon from the main wall. Access the base by scrambling down to the terrace/ledge from just below the big boulder that guards the upper canyon.

content.description:
North facing cliff up the South hillside of the hairpin turn canyon. The cliff is the South (left) side of a narrow (4-12' wide) canyon that can be seen from the hairpin turn parking pullout. Because the canyon is so narrow boulders have gotten wedged in the canyon and sand and rock have filled in the up canyon side of them creating several flat terraces to belay from. 

  All the hardware has been camouflaged to match to rock color.
